WindwardRestApi.Api

Class WindwardClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • WindwardRestApi.Api.WindwardClient

  • public class WindwardClient
extends java.lang.Object
    All calls to the Windward RESTful Engine are made by this object. All calls are synchronous. In addition all operations performed by the RESTful engine are async (not synchronous) so for most calls you will make a call to submit a job, then make call(s) to get the status of the job, then a call to get the results of the job, and finally a call to delete the job.
    On an error at the server end, the error will be returned by this client's call throwing an exception.
    Create a singleton on this object and reuse it. This creates a new HttpURLConnection for each call (reusing a HttpURLConnection has limitations and as the library we don't control that).
    This class uses log4j, but does not initialize it. It assumes you have initialized it in the manner you prefer.

      static interface  WindwardClient.CreateConnection
      To deliver connections to WindwardClient implement a class from this interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindwardClient

        public WindwardClient(java.lang.String urlHost)
        Create the object. One object can make multiple calls (each call creates a new HttpURLConnection).
        Parameters:
        urlHost - The base address of Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the Internet resource used when sending requests. The uri must end with a /.

      • WindwardClient

        public WindwardClient(WindwardClient.CreateConnection connectionFactory)
        Create the object. One object can make multiple calls (each call creates a new HttpURLConnection).
        Parameters:
        connectionFactory - An object that creates the HttpURLConnection objects this uses for requests.

    • Method Detail

      • getLicense

        public java.lang.String getLicense()
        The license passed in each connection in the header to use for this request. If null, the REST engine uses its own license key.

      • setLicense

        public void setLicense(java.lang.String licenseKey)
        The license passed in each connection in the header to use for this request. If null, the REST engine uses its own license key.

      • postDocument

        public Document postDocument(Template template)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ApiException
        Post a request to generate a document. This method completes when the request has been accepted by the RESTful engine. The document generation may not have started when this returns, but the request has been accepted. The only valid values in the returned Document are the Guid and Tag.
        Parameters:
        template - The template to parse for the document.
        Returns:
        The Guid of this requested job.
        Throws:
        ApiException - The server returned a status code other than 200 ... 203
        java.io.IOException

      • getDocumentStatus

        public int getDocumentStatus(java.lang.String guid)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Get the status of this requested document generation job.
        Parameters:
        guid - The identifier for this job.
        Returns:
        The status of this job: 201 (created) the job is in process, 202 (accepted), the job is pending, 302 (found) is the job is completed and can be read, 404 (not found) this job does not exist, and 500 (internal server error) something broke, which includes an invalid request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDocument

        public Document getDocument(java.lang.String guid)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            ApiException
        Get the generated document. If there was an error generating the document this will throw a ServerException with the error.
        Parameters:
        guid - The identifier for this job.
        Returns:
        The generated document.
        Throws:
        ServerException - An error occurred generating the document in the RESTful engine. This exception contains the error information from the server.
        ApiException - The server returned a status code other than 200 (the ServerException case does return a 200).
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteDocument

        public int deleteDocument(java.lang.String guid)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Delete a generated document from the RESTful engine. Once this is done you will not be able to get it again.
        Parameters:
        guid - The identifier for this job.
        Returns:
        The http status code. 200 if successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • postMetrics

        public Metrics postMetrics(Template template)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           ApiException
        Post a request to generate a document's metrics. This method completes when the request has been accepted by the RESTful engine. The document metrics parsing may not have started when this returns, but the request has been accepted. The only valid values in the returned Metrics are the Guid and Tag.
        Parameters:
        template - The template to parse for the metrics.
        Returns:
        The Guid of this requested job.
        Throws:
        ApiException - The server returned a status code other than 200 ... 203
        java.io.IOException
